member.name: T:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl
member.summary: Represents a WPF control that wraps an Awesomium web view. You can use it to embed Awesomium directly in your WPF application without any additional work.
member.remarks:
You can create an instance of this class by directly invoking the default constructor (either by dropping it in your designer surface, through XAML or from code). You do not need to explicitly create an instance of a web view through . WebControl takes care of this internally.
Note that it is safe to use this control in a design environment for layout and configuration purposes. and the underlying web view are only instantiated during runtime.
The Role of the Property: In addition to its regular meaning, the property indicates if internal asynchronous rendering of the underlying web-view, is currently enabled.
All rendering in the underlying web-view is actually done asynchronously in a separate process and so the page is usually continuously rendering internally. Setting to false, will temporarily pause rendering. This may be really important, if is enabled.
The Role of the Property: A is considered invalid when it is:
Crashed (see ).
When crashed, this control will attempt to recreate its underlying view. For details, see: .
Prematurely destroyed (see and ).
Not properly instantiated. This means that something went wrong during instantiation of either the (if this is the first created) or of the underlying web-view.
Developers should always check this property before calling members implemented by this . Trying to access the underlying web-view when it is not alive, can throw an .
For more details, refer to the documentation of this control's members.
also returns false when the control is shown in a designer. The Awesomium and the underlying web-view, are only instantiated during runtime.

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.GoToHome
member.summary: Navigates to the Home URL as defined in .
member.returns: true if the command was successfully sent. false otherwise.

member.returns: true if the view can go forward in history. false otherwise.

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.GetLastError
member.summary: Check if an error occurred during the last synchronous Javascript interoperation call.
member.returns: An value indicating the error that may have occurred during the last synchronous Javascript interoperation API call.

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ExecuteJavascript(System.String)
member.summary: Executes some JavaScript asynchronously in the main frame of the page.
member.param: The string of JavaScript to execute.
member.exception: The member is called on an invalid view. (See: )

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ExecuteJavascript(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Executes some JavaScript asynchronously on the page.
member.param: The string of JavaScript to execute.
The xpath of the frame to execute within; leave this blank to execute in the main frame.
member.exception: The member is called on an invalid view. (See: )

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ExecuteJavascriptWithResult(System.String)
member.summary: Executes some JavaScript synchronously in the main frame of the page, and returns a result.
member.param: The string of JavaScript to execute.
member.returns: Returns the result (if any). Any returned from this method will be a remote proxy for an object contained within the view's process. If this call fails, the returned will have an Undefined type. (see ). You can check for more information about the failure.
member.exception: The member is called on an invalid view. (See: )

member.summary: Executes some JavaScript synchronously on the page, and returns a result.
member.param: The string of JavaScript to execute.
The xpath of the frame to execute within; leave this blank to execute in the main frame.
member.returns: Returns the result (if any). Any returned from this method will be a remote proxy for an object contained within the view's process. If this call fails, the returned will have an Undefined type. (see ). You can check for more information about the failure.
member.exception: The member is called on an invalid view. (See: )

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and initializes an instance of and its underlying web view.

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.Close
member.summary: Destroys and removes this web view control. Any call to members of this control after calling this method, will cause a .
member.remarks: To avoid exceptions, do not call this method when the hosting UI of the control (if any) is still alive and visible.

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.OnIsEnabledChanged(System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Maintains the relationship between the control's enabled status and internal asynchronous rendering (see ).
member.remarks:
In addition to its regular meaning, the property indicates if internal asynchronous rendering of the underlying web-view, is currently active.
All rendering in the underlying web-view is actually done asynchronously in a separate process and so the page is usually continuously rendering internally. Setting to false, will temporarily pause rendering. This may be really important, if is enabled.
Inheritors can override , then set manually if they want to disconnect internal asynchronous rendering, from the control's enabled status.
Note that this method is provided by the WPF so that you can control the relationship between the control's enabled status and internal asynchronous rendering (see ). It does not trigger the event. The event is fired by the .NET Framework before this method is called.

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.FocusView
member.summary: Notifies the current page that it has gained focus.
member.remarks: You will need to call this to gain text-box focus, among other things. (If you fail to ever see a blinking caret when typing text, this is why.)

remarks.note: handles this internally. Inheritors do not need to call this method unless they implement custom logic.
For performance reasons, no validity check is performed when calling protected members. Inheritors should perform any such checks (see ), before calling these members.

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.UnfocusView
member.summary: Notifies the current page that it has lost focus.

remarks.note: handles this internally. Inheritors do not need to call this method unless they implement custom logic.
For performance reasons, no validity check is performed when calling protected members. Inheritors should perform any such checks (see ), before calling these members.

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.InjectMouseMove(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Injects a mouse-move event in local coordinates.
member.param: The absolute x-coordinate of the mouse (relative to the itself).
The absolute y-coordinate of the mouse (relative to the itself).

remarks.note: handles this internally. Inheritors do not need to call this method unless they implement custom logic.
This method bypasses settings of the .
For performance reasons, no validity check is performed when calling protected members. Inheritors should perform any such checks (see ), before calling these members.

This method bypasses settings of the .
For performance reasons, no validity check is performed when calling protected members. Inheritors should perform any such checks (see ), before calling these members.

remarks.note: handles this internally. Inheritors do not need to call this method unless they implement custom logic.
This method bypasses settings of the .
For performance reasons, no validity check is performed when calling protected members. Inheritors should perform any such checks (see ), before calling these members.

member.name: F:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.LatestContextDataProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.BeginNavigation
member.summary: Occurs when a view begins navigating to a new URL.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.CreateSurface
member.summary: Occurs when an is requested by the view. Usually, every time the size of the view changes. You should return your own implementation here.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the selection in the current page, changes.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ProcessCreated
member.summary: Occurs when the child rendering process for this view, has been spawned.
member.remarks: This event also indicates the moment when global Javascript objects can be created. (See: )

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.TitleChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the current page title has changed.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.AddressChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the page URL has changed.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ToolTipChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the tooltip text has changed. You should hide the tooltip when the text is empty.
member.remarks: Technology specific WebControls, present their own tooltip. Set to true, to prevent a WebControl from displaying its predefined tooltip.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.TargetURLChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the target URL has changed. This is usually the result of hovering over a link on a page.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.CursorChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the cursor has changed. This is is usually the result of hovering over different content.
member.remarks: You can set to true, to prevent a technology specific WebControl from changing the visible cursor.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.FocusChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the focused element changes on the page. This is usually the result of text-box being focused or some other user-interaction event.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ShowCreatedWebView
member.summary: Occurs when an creates a new child web-view instance (usually the result of window.open or an external link). It is your responsibility to display this child web-view in your application.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.DocumentReady
member.summary: Occurs when the DOM has finished parsing and the window object is available for JavaScript execution.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.LoadingFrame
member.summary: Occurs when the page begins loading a frame.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.LoadingFrameFailed
member.summary: Occurs when a frame fails to load. See for additional information.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.LoadingFrameComplete
member.summary: Occurs when the page finishes loading a frame.
member.remarks: The main frame always finishes loading last for a given page load.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.SelectLocalFiles
member.summary: Occurs when the page requests to display a file chooser dialog. This is usually the result of a user clicking on an HTML input element with type='file'.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.LoginRequest
member.summary: Occurs when the page needs authentication from the user (for example, Basic HTTP Auth, NTLM Auth, etc.).

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.PrintRequest
member.summary: Occurs when the page requests to print itself. (Usually the result of window.print() being called from JavaScript.) It is your responsibility to print the view to a file and handle the actual device printing.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.PrintFailed
member.summary: Occurs when fails. Typically because of bad printer configuration or invalid output path (see ).

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.PrintComplete
member.summary: Occurs when a operation, completes successfully.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ShowPopupMenu
member.summary: Occurs when the page requests to display a drop-down (popup) menu. This is usually the result of a user clicking on a select HTML input element.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ShowContextMenu
member.summary: Occurs when the page requests to display a context menu. This is usually the result of a user right-clicking on an element or plugin in the page.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ResponsiveChanged
member.summary: Occurs when this view's process hangs, or becomes responsive after a hang. Use or to check the current state of the process.

member.name: E:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.Crashed
member.summary: This event occurs when this view's process crashes.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.CanRecreateView
member.summary: Gets if this control wraps a previously crashed view that can be recreated.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.Layers
member.summary: Gets a list of UI layers currently visible.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ContextMenuResourceKey
member.summary: Gets the resource key for the context menu of a .
member.remarks: This can be used to override the default context menu.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ContextMenuPageItemsArrayRecourceKey
member.summary: Gets the resource key for an array of items in the context menu of a , that are visible when you right-click on a page that has no selection and no keyboard focus.

remarks.para: You can use this resource key to override the items in the context menu of a , that are visible when you right-click on a page that has no selection and no keyboard focus.
remarks.note: If you only wish to add items to the predefined ones, keep in mind that you have to redefine all the items of the array.

member.example:
The default-predefined array in XAML is:
<x:Array x:Key="{x:Static awe:WebControl.ContextMenuPageItemsArrayRecourceKey}" Type="{x:Type DependencyObject}"> <MenuItem Command="BrowseBack" /> <MenuItem Command="BrowseForward" /> <MenuItem Command="Refresh" /> <Separator /> <MenuItem Command="Print" /> <Separator /> <MenuItem Command="SelectAll" /> </x:Array>

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ContextMenuInputItemsArrayRecourceKey
member.summary: Gets the resource key for an array of items in the context menu of a , that are visible when the control has keyboard focus.

remarks.para: You can use this resource key to override the items in the context menu of a , that are visible when the control has keyboard focus.
remarks.note: If you only wish to add items to the predefined ones, keep in mind that you have to redefine all the items of the array.

member.example:
The default-predefined array in XAML is:
<x:Array x:Key="{x:Static awe:WebControl.ContextMenuInputItemsArrayRecourceKey}" Type="{x:Type DependencyObject}"> <MenuItem Command="Copy" /> <MenuItem Command="Cut" /> <MenuItem Command="Paste" /> <Separator /> <MenuItem Command="SelectAll" /> </x:Array>

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ContextMenuSelectionItemsArrayRecourceKey
member.summary: Gets the resource key for an array of items in the context menu of a , that are visible when a range of content in the page is currently selected.

remarks.para: You can use this resource key to override the items in the context menu of a , that are visible when a range of content in the page is currently selected.
remarks.note: If you only wish to add items to the predefined ones, keep in mind that you have to redefine all the items of the array.

member.example:
The default-predefined array in XAML is:
<x:Array x:Key="{x:Static awe:WebControl.ContextMenuSelectionItemsArrayRecourceKey}" Type="{x:Type DependencyObject}"> <MenuItem Command="Copy" /> <MenuItem Command="{x:Static awe:WebControlCommands.CopyHTML}" /> <Separator /> </x:Array>

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ContextMenuImageItemsArrayRecourceKey
member.summary: Gets the resource key for an array of items in the context menu of a , that are visible when you right-click on an image in a page.

remarks.para: You can use this resource key to override the items in the context menu of a , that are visible when you right-click on an image in a page.
remarks.note: If you only wish to add items to the predefined ones, keep in mind that you have to redefine all the items of the array.

member.example:
The default-predefined array in XAML is:
<x:Array x:Key="{x:Static awe:WebControl.ContextMenuImageItemsArrayRecourceKey}" Type="{x:Type DependencyObject}"> <MenuItem Command="{x:Static awe:WebControlCommands.CopyImage}" /> <Separator /> </x:Array>

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ContextMenuLinkItemsArrayRecourceKey
member.summary: Gets the resource key for an array of items in the context menu of a , that are visible when you right-click on a link in a page.

remarks.para: You can use this resource key to override the items in the context menu of a , that are visible when you right-click on a link in a page.
remarks.note: If you only wish to add items to the predefined ones, keep in mind that you have to redefine all the items of the array.

member.example:
The default-predefined array in XAML is:
<x:Array x:Key="{x:Static awe:WebControl.ContextMenuLinkItemsArrayRecourceKey}" Type="{x:Type DependencyObject}"> <MenuItem Command="{x:Static awe:WebControlCommands.CopyLinkAddress}" /> <Separator /> </x:Array>

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ToolTipResourceKey
member.summary: Gets the resource key for the tool-tip of a .
member.remarks: This can be used to override the default tool-tip.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.Handle
member.summary: Gets the handle to the underlying web-view instance.
member.remarks:
You can use this property to create a wrapper for a web-view that has been internally created by Awesomium. Views are created internally by Awesomium for external links that should be opened in a new view, or popup windows (See Javascript: window.open).
Once assigned and the control goes live, this property cannot be changed. Attempting to do so, will fail silently.
member.exception: Attempted to wrap a web-view instance that has already been wrapped.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.IsLive
member.summary: Gets if the native web-view, is alive.
member.returns:
A value indicating if the native web-view, is alive. False indicates that the native web-view is:
Crashed (see ).
When crashed, technology specific WebControls will attempt to recreate the underlying view. For details, see: .
Prematurely destroyed (eg, using ).
Not properly instantiated. This means that something went wrong during instantiation of either the (if this is the first view created) or of the native web-view.
member.remarks:
Developers should always check this property before calling members. Trying to access the native web-view when it is not alive, can throw an .
For more details, refer to the documentation of view members.
This property also returns false when the technology specific WebControls are shown in a designer. The Awesomium and the native web-view, are only instantiated during runtime.

example.code:
Private Sub ToolStripButton2_Click( sender As Object, e As EventArgs ) Handles ToolStripButton2.Click If Not m_WebControl.IsLive Then Return
m_WebControl.GoForward() End Sub

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.IsProcessCreated
member.summary: Gets if the child rendering process for this view, has been spawned.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.Title
member.summary: Gets the title of the page currently loaded.
member.remarks: This property may also reflect navigation progress. For details, see .

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.HasTitle
member.summary: Gets if the currently loaded web-page has a title.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.IsLoading
member.summary: Gets if any page resources are loading.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.IsNavigating
member.summary: Gets if the web-view is currently navigating to a Url.
member.remarks: Unlike that updates when the actual contents of a page are being downloaded, this property is updated when navigation starts and updates again when loading completes.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.IsCrashed
member.summary: Gets if the web-view process has been crashed.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.IsDocumentReady
member.summary: Gets if DOM (Document Object Model) for the page being loaded, is ready.
member.remarks: This is very useful for executing Javascript on a page before its content has finished loading.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.IsResponsive
member.summary: Gets if the web-view process is currently responsive.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.TargetURL
member.summary: Gets the target URL indicated by the web-view, usually as a result of hovering over a link on the page.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.HasTargetURL
member.summary: Gets if the web-view is currently indicating a target URL, usually as a result of hovering over a link on the page.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.Selection
member.summary: Gets a providing information about the current selection range.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the current URL presented by this .
member.returns: An absolute representing the current URL presented by this .

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.NavigationInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the navigation info level.
member.returns: A value indicating the level of navigation progress info reflected to the . The default is .
member.remarks:
Navigation progress information is reflected to the control's :
Level Title Value
"None" Title only reflects the page's title, if any.
"Normal" Title reflects the page's title as well as "Error" and "Crashed" status.
"Verbose"
Title reflects progress status such as "Navigating..." and "Loading...", until the page's title is acquired. Also reflects "Error" and "Crashed" status. (Default)

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.IsRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets if internal asynchronous rendering is currently enabled.
member.remarks:
All rendering is actually done asynchronously in a separate process and so the page is usually continuously rendering internally.
This property is automatically updated by monitoring the control's enabled status and it should not be manually set. The update occurs in .
Inheritors can override , then set this property manually if they want to disconnect internal asynchronous rendering, from the control's enabled status.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl.ProcessInput
member.summary: Gets or sets the user input that this control's surface should process.

member.name: T:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControlDialogLayer
member.summary: Represents a dialog layer displayed over a .
member.remarks: Dialog layers are reusable. They should be created only once in the lifetime of the they will be used with. You should later use the and methods to show or hide the layer when needed.

member.name: T:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControlLayer
member.summary: Base class of all control layers associated to a .
member.remarks: You cannot directly derive from this class. You should instead subclass a pre-defined derived class such as .

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControlLayer.#ctor(Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControl)
member.summary: Creates an instance of .
member.param: Indicated the parent the layer belongs too.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControlLayer.ParentControl
member.summary: Gets the parent the layer belongs to.

member.name: P:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControlLayer.IsContentVisual
member.summary: Gets if the specified should be treated as visual content, or as a data provider only. The default is false which means that the content will be treated as a data provider, visualized using the .
member.remarks: Regularly, the use of DataTemplates is preferred when visualizing data, compared to direct visual Content. DataTemplates allow flexible use of Triggers etc.. In such scenarios, the WebControl or the layers themselves are used as Content (so that the DataTemplate can access them as data providers). Without this property, WPF would attempt to remove the visual Content from the visual tree and add it as a child of this ContentControl.

member.name: T:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControlContextMenu
member.summary: Predefined stylable context menu used by .
member.remarks:
There are multiple ways to customize, override or block the context menu of a . These are described in the following list:
Action Result
Redefine a application resource, using the as key.
Completely substitutes the default context menu. You should bind the property to the property, to access the . You can later use the provided through to update the state of the menu's items.
Assign your own context menu to the property. Same as before but in this case you should provide your own display context data.
Redefine one or more arrays of menu items in your application resources, using the following keys (depending to the group you wish to substitute or change):
Substitutes or edits specific menu items' groups, that are visible according to the current context. For more details, read the documentation of the resource keys.
Handle the event and set the property to true. This will block the default context menu from displaying. You can then manually display your own context menu.

member.summary: Gets or sets the instance used to provide data to the context menu.

member.name: M:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.Utilities.Respond(Awesomium.Core.JavascriptDialogEventArgs)
member.summary: Allows users to respond to a event, when the event is handled modally.
member.param: Data provided to a event.
member.remarks:
This method should only be called if you handle the modally.
The WPF , automatically displays a in response to the event. Users can subclass to provide their own logic or look and feel if they want. If you style your , simply assign the command to the buttons of your dialog layer, specifying a CommandParameter of true or false to indicate OK or Cancel respectively.
Calling this method will also automatically set to true. You will no longer be able to change the setting of after calling this method.
For more details, read the Remarks section of .

member.name: T:Awesomium.Windows.Controls.WebControlCommands
member.summary: Defines routed commands that are common to a .
member.remarks:
In addition to the specific routed UI commands defined in , the reuses many of the and available with the .NET Framework. In order to get the text of these commands displayed in your system's locale, you may need to download a Microsoft .NET Framework 4 Client Language Pack (x86 x64).
The text of the commands specified in this class, can be localized by adding more localization resources to the assembly.
